content: I am sitting in a chair.

[{"sentence": "Mahu tü-katünnu-gwee-ddu-ikka sooma'i-dü.", "translation": "He's rocking in his chair."}, {"sentence": "Katünnu-ba'-ikka nüü katü-ni-ukka tasinguyubi-ti.", "translation": "While I sat on that chair, my legs fell asleep."}, {"sentence": "Mii'ukka nüü 'adaamudüdi'i-wee-tugu katü-wei.", "translation": "I am going to sit in the car now."}, {"sentence": "Nüü 'üwi-katü-dü.", "translation": "I am sitting down *sleeping."}, {"sentence": "Nüü pagatü-dei-wei.", "translation": "I'll sit in the water."}]

[{"lexical_unit": "nükka", "senses": [{"gloss": "me", "definition": "Me, to me, mine, demonstrative pronoun, possessive pronoun.", "examples": [{"form": "Tu'ihiinno' nükka-su yaduhi-ti.", "translation": "He's always spoken to me."}, {"form": "Nükkana-sü' i-düniwaa-wei.", "translation": "He'll only teach me."}, {"form": "Nüü nükkana-sü' nawahii-maa-gü-ti.", "translation": "I'm buying clothes just for myself."}, {"form": "Mahu nükkana.", "translation": "That one's mine."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "nükkana", "senses": [{"gloss": "me", "definition": "Me, to me, demonstrative pronoun, possessive pronoun.", "examples": []}]}, {"lexical_unit": "nüü", "senses": [{"gloss": "I", "definition": "I, first person, subject pronoun.", "examples": [{"form": "Nüü tsaŵu-iddu.", "translation": "I am good."}, {"form": "Tsaŵu nüü naama-ti.", "translation": "I'm feeling good."}, {"form": "Nüügwa nasümü tutuapi-ii payahuupü-wee mia-ti.", "translation": "We and all the kids went to the river."}, {"form": "Nüügwa nüümü-neikka 'a-nobi-gwee-ddu 'ia kimma-dü.", "translation": "We are coming back from their Indian community there."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "nü", "senses": [{"gloss": "me", "definition": "Me, prefixes to postpositions.", "examples": [{"form": "Nü-baa katü-gi.", "translation": "Come sit by me."}, {"form": "Songayabi-ii nü-mama tsibui-ti.", "translation": "The spider is climbing on my."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "'i", "senses": [{"gloss": "me", "definition": "To me (attaches to transitive verbs).", "examples": [{"form": "'Oonno'oho 'uhu 'i-düngü-ti hüüpi'i-baa-tugu-ukka yeishi 'uhu 'awa-ggu\n                        'uhu 'i-gia-ti.", "translation": "And then, he asked me to go over to the lady and then she gave me a\n                            lot."}, {"form": "Maattü-eika 'i-gia.", "translation": "Give that to me."}]}]}]

[{"lexical_unit": "katü", "senses": [{"gloss": "sit", "definition": "To sit down.", "examples": [{"form": "'Io katü-gi nü-baa.", "translation": "Come sit here by me."}]}, {"gloss": "stay", "definition": "To stay at a certain place, to reside at a place.", "examples": [{"form": "Kadu' nüü katü-baa sugwei-ti pünebü nüü mia-wei.", "translation": "I don't want to stay around. I should get going."}, {"form": "'Uhu-dii-büü 'u-wee katü-ni-ukka na-gia-dua-pü subaa.", "translation": "Maybe she could indeed be given (that land) if she'd stay there."}, {"form": "Subaa 'uhu toya-ŵa katü-dü.", "translation": "Maybe he lives in the mountains."}, {"form": "Nüü 'i-ŵu'a-ŵü-neikka 'ihutsi'i-ŵü-neikka tü-gatü-gü-dü.", "translation": "I'm going to have my grandchildren stay (so that I can watch them)."}, {"form": "'Iannaha nüü 'i-gaani'i-naha-neikka tü-gatü-gü-wei 'ü-düwoobü-wee-ukka.", "translation": "I'm going to keep my cows over there in your field."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "tsakatügü", "senses": [{"gloss": "sit (something) down", "definition": "To sit something down (in a sitting position), to have someone stay at a\n                        certain place or location.", "examples": [{"form": null, "translation": null}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "yuuna", "senses": [{"gloss": "put", "definition": null, "examples": []}, {"gloss": "put", "definition": null, "examples": []}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-yükwi", "senses": [{"gloss": "sit (plural)", "definition": "To sit (plural) doing something, to stay/reside (plural) while doing\n                        something.", "examples": [{"form": "U-'aaŵoho-ukka-düa-büü hühüübichi'-uu tüzoo-yükwi-ti.", "translation": "The next day, the old ladies were sitting around sad/lonely."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "yükwi", "senses": [{"gloss": "sit (plural)", "definition": "To sit plural, to sit in a group, to say/reside of a number of people.", "examples": [{"form": "Tu'ihaga-ii kimma-si-ukka 'oonno'oho yükwi-ti tübina.", "translation": "Once everyone came they sat down on the ground."}, {"form": "'Iattü-ii nüümü-ii tünaa-dugu yükwi-tügü-ti kadu' i-düŵaabü'a-dei-shi.", "translation": "Those people over there are just sitting down and not helping."}]}]}]

[{"lexical_unit": "katünnu", "senses": [{"gloss": "chair", "definition": "A chair or seat, something to sit on.", "examples": [{"form": "Tibo-neikka 'a-nahuwee katünnu-neikka 'a-dügü 'oonno'oho nüümü-ii 'a-ba'
                        katü-wei.", "translation": "Place the chairs around the table and then the people will sit on
                            them."}, {"form": "Mahu katünnu-neikka 'a-ŵama natsakkadü-pü.", "translation": "She's using the chair to brace hereself/keep herself in place."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "tibo", "senses": [{"gloss": "table", "definition": "Table.", "examples": [{"form": "Tibo-neikka 'a-düka-dduna.", "translation": "Set the table."}, {"form": "Wihi-ii tibo-ba' na-dügü-ti.", "translation": "The knife was placed on the table."}, {"form": "Nüügwa nasümü katü-dei-shi tibo-wee-ukka 'oonnoho nüügwa wanaaha'i-ti.", "translation": "We all sat at the table and we played cards."}, {"form": "Tibo-ba'a-ddü-eikka-daagwa tüka-wei müha.", "translation": "We will now eat what is on the table."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "'adaamubüdi'", "senses": [{"gloss": "automobile, car", "definition": null, "examples": []}]}, {"lexical_unit": "hibinobi", "senses": [{"gloss": "bar (saloon)", "definition": null, "examples": []}]}, {"lexical_unit": "huubü", "senses": [{"gloss": "cradle board", "definition": "Cradle board basket, baby basket.", "examples": [{"form": "Tsaŵu huubü-uu 'u-wüü-'i-da'.", "translation": "The cradle board secures him well."}, {"form": "Bibi'-aa 'u-wee-kku 'u-na-dutta-nna huubü-uu. Püdü-bibi'-okka tsaŵu-su
                        'uhu tüüchi'i-nia-ggu na-ŵaappa'i-gü-si 'oonno'oho tsaŵu na-hida-'i-dü.", "translation": "That cradle board is what a baby is laced in. It's made better for a
                            newborn that is a little smaller and it is held well (speaking of
                            cradleboard for newborn with naval still attached)."}]}]}]

[{"lexical_unit": "-pa'", "senses": [{"gloss": "on", "definition": "On top, up, above.", "examples": [{"form": "Mahu tü-hiibü-neikka nobi-ba'a-ddü-eikka 'a-basei-wei-neikka 'a-buhei-ti.", "translation": "He's looking for the leak on top of the roof of the house."}, {"form": "Nüü 'a-ba' katü-wei tübipü-neikka.", "translation": "I'm going to sit on the dirt."}, {"form": "Tübbi-ba'a-ikka 'a-dügü-dei-shi 'a-hani.", "translation": "Place it on top of that rock, then do it."}, {"form": "'Ikkana nüü nana-papa' a-dügü-ti.", "translation": "I'm putting these on top of one another."}]}, {"gloss": "above", "definition": "Up above.", "examples": [{"form": "Püyü-ii pa'a 'ia na-bakia-ti paya-neikka.", "translation": "The duck is over there on top the water bathing."}, {"form": "Nüü-büü 'u-düüya-'ei pa'a 'ia 'i-dügü-wei-nokka.", "translation": "I'm afraid each time to place it high above over there."}, {"form": "Pa'a-su nüü 'aannaha mia-ni pitü-hu-gaa-wei.", "translation": "I'll go higher there, then arrive."}, {"form": "Nüü pa'a-su 'ia mia-wei 'u-tugu.", "translation": "I'll go a higher way/route."}, {"form": "'Uhuŵa-su pa'a-su nobi-püga.", "translation": "They used to live higher up on their own."}, {"form": "Pa'a'ube.", "translation": "Up above, back in here."}, {"form": "Taagwa tei-kootsi'i-naha-neikka 'aattaga 'a-damühü-wei yeishi-daa
                        'a-wee-kku 'a-wükütsü'i-shi-ukka 'oonno'oho 'a-ba'a-nia-su 'a-'üdzü'ü-hu-si
                        taagwa tü-batsa-wei.", "translation": "We'll round up our pigs and confine them in that (pen), and then if
                            the cold temperature become more so, we'll butcher one."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "'iiga", "senses": [{"gloss": "enter", "definition": "To enter, to go inside.", "examples": [{"form": "Tü-zagwünü-gü-si 'üügwa pipaa-ttugu 'iiga.", "translation": "Park and then enter through the back."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "hiiga", "senses": [{"gloss": "enter", "definition": "To enter, to go inside.", "examples": []}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-'aka", "senses": [{"gloss": "among, in the midst of", "definition": "Among, within a group, in the midst of.", "examples": [{"form": "Oonno' ukkahu 'uhu sühü-'aga-tugu 'uhu tsupa-ka' u-be oonno'oho
                        sümü'ü-su-düa tapona-kini.", "translation": "Then that one disappeared into the willows and then one other started
                            to appeared/come out."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "tabe-", "senses": [{"gloss": "sun (in)", "definition": "To do (action) in the sun, adverbial prefix, prefixes to verbs.", "examples": [{"form": "Nüü-büü tabe-wünü-dü. Nüü 'üdzü'ü-gaa-ni 'ionnoho kimma-ti
                        tabe-wünü-gi-dü.", "translation": "I'm standing in the sun. Once I became cold, I came right here to
                            stand in the sun."}]}]}]

[{"lexical_unit": "-dü", "senses": [{"gloss": "present", "definition": "Verbal suffix ending that indicates the action is happening in the present
                        tense, or in the process of doing it; also makes verbs into nouns by
                        indicating the doer of the action. Also, signifies habitual tense.", "examples": [{"form": "Sawa-dü-eikka 'a-düŵaabü'a.", "translation": "Help the one that's cooking."}, {"form": "'Uhu tü-nawahii-nokka 'u-zamüna-gaa-dü.", "translation": "He's going to go change his clothes."}, {"form": "Haga mii 'üni-dü-uu?", "translation": "Who's the one who said that?"}, {"form": "Haga 'aaŵahu-ukka sawa-wei-dü-ii?", "translation": "Who will be the one to cook tomorrow?"}, {"form": "Haga 'i-bida-gü-weidü-ii 'i-sawa-ku-su-ukka.", "translation": "Who will make me fire when I cook."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "mane'i", "senses": [{"gloss": "continuously", "definition": "Describes an action happening continuously, also attaches to verbs stating
                        that action happening continously or uninterrupted.", "examples": [{"form": "'Awazu-ukka pabahaanno-su mane'i-dü.", "translation": "Later on, it continously became wider (speaking of the land)."}, {"form": "'Oonno'oho nüügwa 'aannaha pitü-bitü-gaa-si-ukka 'uhuŵa tüka-mane'i-ti
                        (mano'oi-ti).", "translation": "And then, once we arrived there, they were eating uninterrupted."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-ttü'", "senses": [{"gloss": "continuous", "definition": "Suffixes to a verb stating that the action is in a continuous state or
                        uninterrupted.", "examples": [{"form": "Yeishi 'uhu tü-kwadzi-nokka paya-wee-ukka 'u-dügü-ti. 'Oonno'oho-ya' uhu
                        'aannaha katü-ttü' katü-ttü'.", "translation": "Then he placed his tail in the water. And then, there he apparently
                            sat and sat."}, {"form": "'Oonno'oho saki-chi'i-wee-ddu kahiinno'o-iddu hüü-iddu 'oonno'oho
                        moo-ttü'.", "translation": "At that time, there were a small amount (of people) in a boat,
                            continuously traveling."}, {"form": "Isha’-uu mii nana-’itawa-ti. Nana-küsidua-si na-pidügü-ttü’. “Nüü-büü
                        isha’ üü-büü küma’a-su” mii nana-’itawa-nna, Oo-togo-ho nana-küsidua-si
                        na-pidügü-ti.", "translation": "The coyotes were saying to one another. Growling at each other,
                            fighting. "I'm coyote, you're another one," they said to one another,
                            growling at each and other fighting."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-kuka'", "senses": [{"gloss": "progress", "definition": "Expresses advancement of an action, or moving toward stages do that
                        action, present tense.", "examples": [{"form": "Nana-'adaŵi mahuŵa miŵia-ku-ka'.", "translation": "Moving forward in different ways from one another (towards different
                            outcome/goals)."}, {"form": "'Uhu subaa kahinno'o-ttogo na-boyoha-tüngü-ti oonno'oho küma'a-su-düa
                        poyoha-ku-ka'a-su-düa.", "translation": "Maybe he's told to run for a short time and then someone else then
                            runs further (said of runners running relay style)."}, {"form": "Hüzamaa' üü 'oonno'oho 'u-hani-kugaa-wei.", "translation": "At that time, you move ahead doing it (task) slowly."}, {"form": "Wiga-du-wei-daagwa kammü-ga-kugaa-si.", "translation": "We'll make a rabbit blanket, upon collecting the rabbits (needed)."}, {"form": "Taagwa kuma-kukaa-wei toyabi-nokka.", "translation": "We'll make our way up over that mountain."}, {"form": "Nüü 'u-ho-ddo yaduha-maa-ku-si tüka-ku-ka'.", "translation": "I'd cease talking with her and then continue eating."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-ti", "senses": [{"gloss": "ing", "definition": "Present/Past tense, "This marker does not make a distinction between
                        present and past tense. It is a realis marker, and asserts that some
                        activity has begun, and may or may not have been brought to completion,"
                        from Evan J. Noris A Grammar Sketch and Comparative of Eastern Mono.", "examples": [{"form": "Nüü natügünaa yaduha-ti.", "translation": "I'm continuously talking."}]}]}]
Nüü katünnu-ba' katü-ti.
The one who ran has seen Rebecca and met her.

function.name: search_sentences
function.arguments: {"query": "The one who ran has seen Rebecca and met her."}

content:
[{"sentence": "'Ui-güŵabaa mia-dü-uu 'ui-wüküna-kaayugi-ti.", "translation": "The one who went beside them almost ran them over."}, {"sentence": "'Oonno'oho bibi'-ki-uu mii'uka poyoha-'i-mia-boo-ti
                        'u-na-ŵaatta-tei-nna-uu.", "translation": "And then the baby that she left is now running around."}, {"sentence": "Carol-uu 'u-dapenno'o-ti 'aanna-iddu-hu yeishi 'uhuŵa naŵi-ddu
                        nana-ppipinna kigimma-ti.", "translation": "Carol met them, and from there they both came behind one another."}, {"sentence": "'Uhu nii-buni-shi-ukka nii-hida-bitü.", "translation": "Once she saw us, she came over/arrived to hug us."}, {"sentence": "Siipü'-maanna'-uu 'u-buni-kaa-si-ukka 'unni-ggu-hu 'uhu
                        nuhi-zhügwüda-kida' mia-tei-ti 'u-gahinno 'oonno'oho tü-bitaŵa-tuha.", "translation": "Once the sheep man noticed that he ran really fast toward him and then
                            checked on him."}]

[{"lexical_unit": "-du'i", "senses": [{"gloss": "PAST", "definition": "Expression word making phrases in past-tense context.", "examples": [{"form": "Mahu 'i-wüü-kaa-wei-du'i.", "translation": "He was going to catch me."}, {"form": "Kadu' tsügwüda-du'i.", "translation": "It was not nearly as fast."}, {"form": "Tuihii-du'i 'aannaha püünuhu-daagwa ka'a-su 'u-bbumaadzi-dua-pü.", "translation": "Just about everything was there, however we wouldn't recognize it yet."}, {"form": "Süŵübaa nüü-du'i.", "translation": "I think I can (I just may be able to)."}, {"form": "Nüü-du'i 'ü-dzakoonohi-gü-dua-pü 'u-subasa-ni-ukka 'üü hupinagwa
                        'ü-gwünü-nokka.", "translation": "I could have openned the door for you had I known you were standing
                            outside."}, {"form": "Kadu' nüü-du'i yaduha-nna.", "translation": "Excuse me, I didn't mean it."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-pü", "senses": [{"gloss": "PAST", "definition": "Past tense particle, attaches to end of verbs. Shows an action has been
                        done and the results of that action is still felt or evident. The one or
                        thing that does the action.", "examples": [{"form": "Nüü muasu koopi'-aa hibi-pü.", "translation": "I already drank some coffee."}, {"form": "Nüü 'üi-dü-gwati-pü-aa tü-zoba-wei.", "translation": "I'll pick up what you've all shot (bullets/arrows)."}, {"form": "Tei-ddaduha-pü-ii koobenno-ttü-aa 'ionnoho ma-na-dügü-pü.", "translation": "The language (we speak) was first to be placed here."}, {"form": "Hüügwa-pü-uu nadüüya-ti.", "translation": "That wind was scary/strong."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-dü", "senses": [{"gloss": "present", "definition": "Verbal suffix ending that indicates the action is happening in the present
                        tense, or in the process of doing it; also makes verbs into nouns by
                        indicating the doer of the action. Also, signifies habitual tense.", "examples": [{"form": "Sawa-dü-eikka 'a-düŵaabü'a.", "translation": "Help the one that's cooking."}, {"form": "'Uhu tü-nawahii-nokka 'u-zamüna-gaa-dü.", "translation": "He's going to go change his clothes."}, {"form": "Haga mii 'üni-dü-uu?", "translation": "Who's the one who said that?"}, {"form": "Haga 'aaŵahu-ukka sawa-wei-dü-ii?", "translation": "Who will be the one to cook tomorrow?"}, {"form": "Haga 'i-bida-gü-weidü-ii 'i-sawa-ku-su-ukka.", "translation": "Who will make me fire when I cook."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-wei", "senses": [{"gloss": "will (future tense)", "definition": "Verb ending for future tense.", "examples": [{"form": "Nüü 'ube mia-wei.", "translation": "I'll go back in there."}, {"form": "Tsaŵu-baa-su tu'ihii mia-wei-dü.", "translation": "Everything is intended to go well."}, {"form": "Hiibü-na nüü 'ü-düükwii-ti 'iattü-okka 'i-nakka-nna? Kwiŵi mia-binaa-ti
                        'uhuŵa Carson-wee tü-dühiibü-nokka na-duhu-gaa-wei-shi.", "translation": "What was it that I told you I heard from over there? They were wanting
                            to go north to Carson, in order to sell something of theirs."}, {"form": "'Uhu tü-doogü'-tsi'-okka na-wütaŵa-pü tü-ma-ggu yeishi 'uhu na-waadzi-ti
                        'uhu 'u-na-pidügü-wei-shi.", "translation": "He had his dog secured/tied to his person, and then he hid being that
                            he'd get into a fight."}, {"form": "Nününü'-uu tei-nakka-gü-wei-shi tei-bei-pihaaŵi-ti.", "translation": "That white person was beconing each one of us over, in order to give
                            us a chance to listen (or be heard?)."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-ti", "senses": [{"gloss": "ing", "definition": "Present/Past tense, "This marker does not make a distinction between
                        present and past tense. It is a realis marker, and asserts that some
                        activity has begun, and may or may not have been brought to completion,"
                        from Evan J. Noris A Grammar Sketch and Comparative of Eastern Mono.", "examples": [{"form": "Nüü natügünaa yaduha-ti.", "translation": "I'm continuously talking."}]}]}]

[{"lexical_unit": "poyoha", "senses": [{"gloss": "run", "definition": "To run using the legs.", "examples": [{"form": "Nüü sakwa 'i-nobi-gwee-tugu poyoha-tei-ku.", "translation": "I should've ran home."}, {"form": "Poboyoha-ti 'uhuŵa 'u-duamü-uu.", "translation": "His children are all running."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "huuseinna", "senses": [{"gloss": "run off", "definition": "Run off (from newly melted snow).", "examples": []}]}, {"lexical_unit": "wüküna", "senses": [{"gloss": "run over", "definition": "To run over or hit with a vehicle, to hold down applying pressure to
                        something.", "examples": [{"form": "'Oonno'oho 'uhu payubü-ŵa 'u-wüküna-ti 'oonno'oho 'u-wüttaŵa-ti tsaŵu.", "translation": "He uses the cloth to apply pressure (to the wound), and then bandages
                            it well."}, {"form": "'Awa-iddu tühidda-ii mia-dü-ii 'uwagattü kadu' yabi mia-dü-uu
                        na-wüküna-ku.", "translation": "Some of the many deer that migrate, and don't move fast enough get run
                            over."}, {"form": "'Üü 'ai-na-wüküna-gü-wei 'annihi 'ai-'itaŵa-ni-ukka.", "translation": "By saying it like that to them, you'll get them run over."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-dui", "senses": [{"gloss": "continue", "definition": "To continue an action, course, or state.", "examples": [{"form": "'A-ŵia-dui.", "translation": "Keep going."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "hukkaŵia", "senses": [{"gloss": "walk", "definition": null, "examples": []}]}]

[{"lexical_unit": "puni", "senses": [{"gloss": "see", "definition": "To see.", "examples": [{"form": "Tsaŵu-iddu i-buni-ku-nna-ii.", "translation": "It's good to see you."}, {"form": "Tsaŵu naama-ti nüü 'ü-buni-si-ukka ('ü-buni-ku-si-ukka).", "translation": "I was happy to see you."}, {"form": "'Ü-buni-kwaa-ti nüü 'u-binna-tugu-su-ukka.", "translation": "I'll see you the next time."}, {"form": "Nüü 'ionnoho wünü-si-ukka kadu' ui-buni-ti.", "translation": "When I stood here, I couldn't see them."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "pitaŵa", "senses": [{"gloss": "look", "definition": "To look at something.", "examples": [{"form": "Naatsi'-ii-bünno' 'a-dübinuhi-wei-gwee-ikka 'iga-tei-ku-si tei-bitaŵa-ti.", "translation": "The boy entered the playhouse then look at us."}, {"form": "Kadu' üügwa tsaŵu tü-bitaŵa-ti.", "translation": "You guys aren't looking around good (enough)."}, {"form": "Tü-baagwa-na na-bitaŵa-gü-gaa-dü.", "translation": "He's going to get his blood looked at (check up on at the doctors)."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "tsapuni", "senses": [{"gloss": "look", "definition": "To take a look while using the hand(s) to move something aside to get a
                        better look.", "examples": []}]}, {"lexical_unit": "puttabühi", "senses": [{"gloss": "see well", "definition": "To be able to see something well, to clearly see something.", "examples": [{"form": "'Oonno'oho nüü ka' tü-buttabühi-ni-ukka 'u-ŵan-dugu mia-ddabi-tei-ti
                        'oonno'oho na-mutsuku'i-bitü-ga'.", "translation": "And then, while I couldn't see clearly, I went right into it, and then
                            bumped my head."}, {"form": "Hanni'i-tugu mahu tü-bittabühi-wei annikku?", "translation": "How is he going to see it now?"}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "tsapitaŵagü", "senses": [{"gloss": "show", "definition": "To show someone by hand, to showcase something, to cause someone to look
                        at something.", "examples": [{"form": "Kadu'u-büü 'ai-zhapitaŵa-gü-dua-pü?", "translation": "Would you show them?"}]}]}]

[{"lexical_unit": "tapenno'o", "senses": [{"gloss": "meet up", "definition": "To meet up with someone, to encounter or meet face to face.", "examples": [{"form": "Nüümü-uu-düa tei-dapinno'o-wei-nna-uu.", "translation": "Those are the Indian people we will meet."}, {"form": "'U-dapenno'o-ti nüügwa 'oonno-kko-ho Lone-Pine-wee-kku pinnahei nüügwa\n                        sibi-mia-weidü.", "translation": "We met them there in Lone Pine because we were to go east (from\n                            there)."}, {"form": "Hanno 'üü 'i-dapenno'o-dua-pü?", "translation": "Where could/would you meet me?"}, {"form": "Tsaŵu-iddu 'i-dapinno'o-ko-nna-ii.", "translation": "It's good to have met (you)."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "subasa", "senses": [{"gloss": "know", "definition": "To know something, to understand something.", "examples": [{"form": "'U-subasa-ti nüü haŵutta 'ü-mia-neikka.", "translation": "I know where you were going/went."}, {"form": "'Üü-bü' u-subasa-ti hanni'i-tugu 'unnihi 'u-mani-nokka?", "translation": "Would you know how that happened?"}, {"form": "Hubia-dui-wei nüü-büü. Ma-subasa-wei 'üü 'ikka.", "translation": "I'm going to sing a song. You'll learn (come to know) this one."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "sudabühi", "senses": [{"gloss": "know (learn)", "definition": "To know in the way of learning something, to come to know or comprehend.", "examples": [{"form": "Püünuhu-daa ka' u-sudabühi-ti.", "translation": "However, we don't know/understand that one."}, {"form": "'Üü-bü' tü-sudabühi-gi-dü nüümü-na 'a-ddaduha-nna?", "translation": "Did you come to learn the Paiute language?"}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "tsamaddahi", "senses": [{"gloss": "know (skill)", "definition": "To know how to work a certain skill.", "examples": [{"form": "Kadu' uhuŵa 'u-zamaddahi-ti.", "translation": "They don't know how to work/perform that."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "maddahi", "senses": [{"gloss": "know (how)", "definition": "To know how to do something.", "examples": [{"form": "'Unni-tugu-hu nüügwa tü-maddahi-püga.", "translation": "We knew how to do it like that."}, {"form": "'U-ŵaddahi-ni-shu 'u-yügwi.", "translation": "When you know more how to do it, act on it."}]}]}]

[{"lexical_unit": "-dü", "senses": [{"gloss": "present", "definition": "Verbal suffix ending that indicates the action is happening in the present
                        tense, or in the process of doing it; also makes verbs into nouns by
                        indicating the doer of the action. Also, signifies habitual tense.", "examples": [{"form": "Sawa-dü-eikka 'a-düŵaabü'a.", "translation": "Help the one that's cooking."}, {"form": "'Uhu tü-nawahii-nokka 'u-zamüna-gaa-dü.", "translation": "He's going to go change his clothes."}, {"form": "Haga mii 'üni-dü-uu?", "translation": "Who's the one who said that?"}, {"form": "Haga 'aaŵahu-ukka sawa-wei-dü-ii?", "translation": "Who will be the one to cook tomorrow?"}, {"form": "Haga 'i-bida-gü-weidü-ii 'i-sawa-ku-su-ukka.", "translation": "Who will make me fire when I cook."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-tügü", "senses": [{"gloss": "in a position", "definition": "In a position doing that action, attaches to a verb.", "examples": [{"form": "'Ionnoho nüü tü-wütui-dei-ni ibettü-eikka katü-tügü-ti.", "translation": "I'm sitting down here waiting for someone inside."}, {"form": "Oonno'oho na-gwükaŵu-tügü-ti.", "translation": "And then, he landed injuring his head."}, {"form": "Taa maano-kko habi-tügü-dua-pü tsaŵu tü-ŵaappa'i-shi.", "translation": "We could stay/lay down there (for the night) if we fixed it up good."}, {"form": "'Uhu-düa aanna-iddu-hu nüü katü-tügü-ti tüka-ku-maa-si-ukka yeishi nüü
                        katü-tügü-ti oonno'oho 'ia müha tutuapi'-ii pibitü-tügü-ti.", "translation": "He was there and I was there sitting down, having finished eating.
                            Then I was sitting and then there kids started to arrived."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-pü", "senses": [{"gloss": "PAST", "definition": "Past tense particle, attaches to end of verbs. Shows an action has been
                        done and the results of that action is still felt or evident. The one or
                        thing that does the action.", "examples": [{"form": "Nüü muasu koopi'-aa hibi-pü.", "translation": "I already drank some coffee."}, {"form": "Nüü 'üi-dü-gwati-pü-aa tü-zoba-wei.", "translation": "I'll pick up what you've all shot (bullets/arrows)."}, {"form": "Tei-ddaduha-pü-ii koobenno-ttü-aa 'ionnoho ma-na-dügü-pü.", "translation": "The language (we speak) was first to be placed here."}, {"form": "Hüügwa-pü-uu nadüüya-ti.", "translation": "That wind was scary/strong."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-wei", "senses": [{"gloss": "will (future tense)", "definition": "Verb ending for future tense.", "examples": [{"form": "Nüü 'ube mia-wei.", "translation": "I'll go back in there."}, {"form": "Tsaŵu-baa-su tu'ihii mia-wei-dü.", "translation": "Everything is intended to go well."}, {"form": "Hiibü-na nüü 'ü-düükwii-ti 'iattü-okka 'i-nakka-nna? Kwiŵi mia-binaa-ti
                        'uhuŵa Carson-wee tü-dühiibü-nokka na-duhu-gaa-wei-shi.", "translation": "What was it that I told you I heard from over there? They were wanting
                            to go north to Carson, in order to sell something of theirs."}, {"form": "'Uhu tü-doogü'-tsi'-okka na-wütaŵa-pü tü-ma-ggu yeishi 'uhu na-waadzi-ti
                        'uhu 'u-na-pidügü-wei-shi.", "translation": "He had his dog secured/tied to his person, and then he hid being that
                            he'd get into a fight."}, {"form": "Nününü'-uu tei-nakka-gü-wei-shi tei-bei-pihaaŵi-ti.", "translation": "That white person was beconing each one of us over, in order to give
                            us a chance to listen (or be heard?)."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "yügwi", "senses": [{"gloss": "do", "definition": "To do to something/someone, to act on, to treat in a manner.", "examples": [{"form": "Kadu' nüü hiimü-na 'aannihi-mana yügwi-dua-pü.", "translation": "I couldn't do anything like that to something."}, {"form": "Kadu' ihi togawano-ukka 'üdzü'ü-ti pinnahei nününü'-ii tei-düwoobü-neikka
                        süta 'a-yügwi-ti.", "translation": "It doesn't get cold at night because the Euro-American people who done
                            bad to our lands (causing it to be warmer)."}, {"form": "Hanni'-wa' mahu 'a-yügwi-dü?", "translation": "What is he doing to him?"}, {"form": "Kadu' uhuŵa 'unnihi tü-na-yügwi-wei-nna suga-ti.", "translation": "They didn't expect that to happend to themselves."}]}]}]

[{"sentence": "Nana-mamia-bodo-dü.", "translation": "They chase one another around."}, {"sentence": "'Oonno'oho püü-gwa-su habi-tügü-dei-shi tü-(gü)-nakka-ddabi-ti.", "translation": "They were laying down by themselves, making clattery noises with their\n                            teeth (biting at the fleas)."}, {"sentence": "'Oonno'oho 'uhu kwinnanu-pa'i-ti kwinnanu-pa'i-ka' nana-pipinna.", "translation": "And then, they twirled and twirled repeatedly behind one another."}, {"sentence": "'Isha'-uu-bünno' naamüdüyaa-dü.", "translation": "The coyote was acting ambitiously."}, {"sentence": "Yeishi 'uhu 'u-doogü'-uu 'u-bioga-tei-ku-ka'.", "translation": "Then his dog pulled him along."}]

[{"lexical_unit": "kwidapugu", "senses": [{"gloss": "dog", "definition": "Dog", "examples": []}]}, {"lexical_unit": "'ishabugu", "senses": [{"gloss": "dog", "definition": "Dog (domestic), coyote-pet.", "examples": [{"form": "Ia-düa ü-'ishabugu-uu tsihaaya'i-shi kimma-ddabi-taa'i-dü.", "translation": "There's your dog again, hungry, coming in a hurry."}, {"form": "Hanno 'i-doogü'?", "translation": "Where is my dog?"}, {"form": "Hanno-kko 'üü 'i-buni-ggü-ti 'i-doogü-tsi'-aa?", "translation": "Where did you spot my dog at?"}, {"form": "Hanno 'ü-gwidapugu-uu?", "translation": "Where's your dog?"}, {"form": "'Ishabugu-neikka 'a-ŵaka.", "translation": "Feed the dog."}, {"form": "Toogü'-uu tsihaya'i-shi paya-na 'uhu tü-gwana-mia-bodo-ti.", "translation": "The dog became hungry, going around smelling for water."}, {"form": "Nüü 'i-doogü'-tsi'-eikka noo-pü pipaa-kku.", "translation": "I brought my dog in the back (of the pickup)."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "toogü'", "senses": [{"gloss": "dog", "definition": "Dog, from English \"dog.\"", "examples": []}]}, {"lexical_unit": "pukkupida'", "senses": [{"gloss": "pet", "definition": "Pet, dog or horse (possibly a worthless pet).", "examples": [{"form": null, "translation": null}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "toopi", "senses": [{"gloss": "wolf", "definition": "wolf", "examples": [{"form": null, "translation": null}]}]}]

                        (mano'oi-ti).", "translation": "And then, once we arrived there, they were eating uninterrupted."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-ttü'", "senses": [{"gloss": "continuous", "definition": "Suffixes to a verb stating that the action is in a continuous state or

                        moo-ttü'.", "translation": "At that time, there were a small amount (of people) in a boat,
                            continuously traveling."}, {"form": "Isha’-uu mii nana-’itawa-ti. Nana-küsidua-si na-pidügü-ttü’. “Nüü-büü

                        na-pidügü-ti.", "translation": "The coyotes were saying to one another. Growling at each other,
                            fighting. "I'm coyote, you're another one," they said to one another,
                            growling at each and other fighting."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-kuka'", "senses": [{"gloss": "progress", "definition": "Expresses advancement of an action, or moving toward stages do that

                            outcome/goals)."}, {"form": "'Uhu subaa kahinno'o-ttogo na-boyoha-tüngü-ti oonno'oho küma'a-su-düa
                        poyoha-ku-ka'a-su-düa.", "translation": "Maybe he's told to run for a short time and then someone else then
                            runs further (said of runners running relay style)."}, {"form": "Hüzamaa' üü 'oonno'oho 'u-hani-kugaa-wei.", "translation": "At that time, you move ahead doing it (task) slowly."}, {"form": "Wiga-du-wei-daagwa kammü-ga-kugaa-si.", "translation": "We'll make a rabbit blanket, upon collecting the rabbits (needed)."}, {"form": "Taagwa kuma-kukaa-wei toyabi-nokka.", "translation": "We'll make our way up over that mountain."}, {"form": "Nüü 'u-ho-ddo yaduha-maa-ku-si tüka-ku-ka'.", "translation": "I'd cease talking with her and then continue eating."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-ti", "senses": [{"gloss": "ing", "definition": "Present/Past tense, "This marker does not make a distinction between

                        from Evan J. Noris A Grammar Sketch and Comparative of Eastern Mono.", "examples": [{"form": "Nüü natügünaa yaduha-ti.", "translation": "I'm continuously talking."}]}]}]

[{"lexical_unit": "-dü", "senses": [{"gloss": "present", "definition": "Verbal suffix ending that indicates the action is happening in the present

                        indicating the doer of the action.                         'uhuŵa Carson-wee tü-dühiibü-nokka na-duhu-gaa-wei-shi.", "translation": "What was it that I told you I heard from over there? They were wanting

                        from Evan J. Noris A Grammar Sketch and Comparative of Eastern Mono.", "examples": [{"form": "Nüü natügünaa yaduha-ti.", "translation": "I'm continuously talking."}]}]}, {"lexical_unit": "-du'i", "senses": [{"gloss": "PAST", "definition": "Expression word making phrases in past-tense context.", "examples": [{"form": "Mahu 'i-wüü-kaa-wei-du'i.", "translation": "He was going to catch me."}, {"form": "Kadu' tsügwüda-du'i.", "translation": "It was not nearly as fast."}, {"form": "Tuihii-du'i 'aannaha püünuhu-daagwa ka'a-su 'u-bbumaadzi-dua-pü.", "translation": "Just about everything was there, however we wouldn't recognize it yet."}, {"form": "Süŵübaa nüü-du'i.", "translation": "I think I can (I just may be able to)."}, {"form": "Nüü-du'i 'ü-dzakoonohi-gü-dua-pü 'u-subasa-ni-ukka 'üü hupinagwa

[{"lexical_unit": "-pa'", "senses": [{"gloss": "on", "definition": "On top, up, above.", "examples": [{"form": "Mahu tü-hiibü-neikka nobi-ba'a-ddü-eikka 'a-basei-wei-neikka 'a-buhei-ti.", "translation": "He's looking for the leak on top of the roof of the house."}, {"form": "Nüü 'a-ba' katü-wei tübipü-neikka.", "translation": "I'm going to sit on the dirt."}, {"form": "Tübbi-ba'a-ikka 'a-dügü-dei-shi 'a-hani.", "translation": "Place it on top of that rock, then do it."}, {"form": "'Ikkana nüü nana-papa' a-dügü-ti.", "translation": "I'm putting these on top of one another."}]}, {"gloss": "above", "definition": "Up above.", "examples": [{"form": "Püyü-ii pa'a 'ia na-bakia-ti paya-neikka.", "translation": "The duck is over there on top the water bathing."}, {"form": "Nüü-büü 'u-düüya-'ei pa'a 'ia 'i-dügü-wei-nokka.", "translation": "I'm afraid each time to place it high above over there."}, {"form": "Pa'a-su nüü 'aannaha mia-ni pitü-hu-gaa-wei.", "translation": "I'll go higher there, then arrive."}, {"form": "Nüü pa'a-su 'ia mia-wei 'u-tugu.", "translation": "I'll go a higher way/route."}, {"form": "'Uhuŵa-su pa'a-su nobi-püga.", "translation": "They used to live higher up on their own."}, {"form": "Pa'a'ube.", "translation": "Up above, back in here."}, {"form": "Taagwa tei-kootsi'i-naha-neikka 'aattaga 'a-damühü-wei yeishi-daa
